questions.question: Given the following METAR: EDDM 250850Z 33005KT 2000 R26R/P1500N R26L/1500N BR SCT002 OVC003 05/05 Q1025 NOSIG
options: a. runway 26R and runway 26L have the same RVR
b. RVR on runway 26R is increasing
c. visibility is reduced by water droplets
d. there is a distinct change in RVR observed

questions.question: What does the abbreviation "NOSIG" mean?
options: a. Not signed by the meteorologist

questions.question:
Refer to TAF below.
EGBB 2618/2712 28015G25KT 9999 SCT025 TEMPO 2618/2622 29018G35KT 5000 SHRASN BKN010CB PROB30 TEMPO 2618/2621 1500 TSGR BKN008CB BECMG 2621/2624 26010KT
From the TAF above you can assume that visibility at 2055Z in Birmingham (EGBB) will be:
options: b. not less than 1.5 km but could be in excess of 10 km
d. a minimum of 1.5 km and a maximum of 5 km

questions.question:
Refer to the following TAF for Zurich.
LSZH 2610/2619 20018G30KT 9999-RA SCT050 BKN080 TEMPO 2610/2615 23012KT 6000-DZ BKN015 BKN030 BECMG 2615/2618 23020G35KT 4000 RA OVC010=
The lowest visibility forecast at ETA Zurich 1430 UTC is:

Which of the following statements is an interpretation of the SIGMET?
SIGMET VALID 121420/121820 embd ts obs and fcst in w part of athinai fir / mov e / intst nc =
options: a. Athens Airport is closed due to thunderstorms. The thunderstorm zone should be east of Athens by 1820 UTC
b. The thunderstorms in the Athens FIR are increasing in intensity, but are stationary above the western part of the Athens FIR
c. Thunderstorms must be expected in the western part of the Athens FIR. The thunderstorm zone is moving east. Intensity is constant
d. Thunderstorms have formed in the eastern part of the Athens FIR and are slowly moving west

questions.question:
In the weather briefing room during the preflight phase of a passenger flight from Zurich to Rome, you examine the following weather reports of pressing importance at the time:
EINN SHANNON 2808 sigmet 2 valid 0800/1100 loc sev turb fcst einn fir blw fl 050 south of 53n wkn =
LIMM MILANO 2809 sigmet 2 valid 0900/1500 mod sev cat btn fl 250 and fl 430 fcst limm fir stnr nc =
EGLL LONDON 2808 sigmet nr01 valid 0800/1200 for london fir isol cb embd in lyr cloud fcst tops fl 300 btn 52n and 54n east of 002e sev ice sev turb ts also fcst mov e wkn =
Which decision is correct?
options: a. Because of the expected turbulence you select a flight level below FL250
b. You show no further interest in these reports, since they do not concern the route to be flown
c. Owing to these reports and taking into account the presence of heavy thunderstorms at planned FL310 you select a higher flight level (FL370)
d. You cancel the flight since the expected dangerous weather conditions along the route would demand too much of the passengers

questions.question:
Refer to the TAF for Bordeaux airport.
FCFR31 281400
LFBD 2815/2824 26015KT 9999 SHRA BKN020 TEMPO 2816/2820 26020G30KT 8000 +SHRA BKN015CB PROB30 2816/2820 TSRA =
Flight Lisbon to Bordeaux, ETA 1800 UTC. What type of precipitation is forecast on the approach to Bordeaux ?
What does the term TREND signify?
options: a. It is a flight forecast, issued by the meteorological station several times daily
b. It is a brief landing forecast added to the actual weather report
c. It is the actual weather report at an aerodrome and is generally issued at half-hourly intervals
d. It is a warning of dangerous meteorological conditions

questions.question:
Compare the following TAF and VOLMET reports for Nice:
TAF 2407/2416 VRB02KT CAVOK =
0920Z 13012KT 8000 SCT040CB BKN100 $20/18$ Q1015 TEMPO $TS=$
What can be concluded from the differences between the two reports?
options: a. That the weather at Nice is clearly more volatile than the TAF could have predicted earlier in the morning
b. That the weather conditions at 0920 were actually predicted in the TAF
c. That the weather in Nice after 0920 is also likely to be as predicted in the TAF
d. That the VOLMET speaker has got his locations mixed up, because there is no way the latest VOLMET report could be so different from the TAF

questions.question: Which statement is true?
options: a. QNH can be 1013.25 only for a station at MSL
b. QNH can be only lower than 1013.25 hPa
c. QNH can not be 1013.25 hPa
d. QNH is lower than 1013.25 hPa at any time

questions.question:
Which of the following statements is an interpretation of the SIGMET?
LSAW SWITZERLAND 0307 SIGMET 2 VALID 030700/031100 LSSW mod to sev cat fcst north of alps btn fl 260 and fl 380 / stnr / intsf =
options: a. Severe turbulence observed below FL260 north of the Alps. Pilots advised to cross this area above FL380
b. Moderate to strong clear air turbulence of constant intensity to be expected north of the Alps
c. Moderate to severe clear air turbulence to be expected north of the Alps. Intensity increasing. Danger zone between FL260 and FL380
d. Zone of moderate to severe turbulence moving towards the area north of the Alps. Intensity increasing. Pilots advised to cross this area above FL260

questions.question:
Refer to the TAF for Amsterdam airport:
FCNL31 281500
EHAM 2816/2901 14010KT 6000-RA SCT025 BECMG 2816/2818 12015G25KT SCT008 BKN013 TEMPO 2818/2823 3000 RA BKN005 OVC010 BECMG 2823/2901 25020KT 8000 NSW BKN020 =
Flight from Bordeaux to Amsterdam, ETA 2100 UTC.
What is the minimum visibility forecast for ETA Amsterdam ?

At a weather station, at 0600 UTC, the air temperature and dew point are respectively: $T=-0.5^{\circ}C$, $DP=-1.5^{\circ}C.$ In the METAR message transmitted by this station, the "temperature group" will be:

Refer to the TAF for Zurich Airport
TAF LSZH 2507/2516 00000KT 0100 FG VV001 BECMG 2508/2510 0800 VV002 BECMG 2510/2512 23005KT 2500 BKN005 TEMPO 2513/2516 6000 SCT007 =
Which of these statements best describes the weather that can be expected at 1200 UTC?
options: a. Meteorological visibility 6 kilometres, cloud base 500 ft, wind speed 5 kt
b. Meteorological visibility 2,5 kilometres, cloud base 500 ft, wind speed 5 kt
c. Meteorological visibility 800 metres, wind from 230°, cloud base 500 ft
d. Meteorological visibility 800 metres, vertical visibility 200 ft, calm

questions.question: In which of the following METAR reports, is the probability of fog formation in the coming night the highest?
In which of the following circumstances is a SIGMET issued?
options: b. Clear ice on the runways of an aerodrome
c. Fog or a thunderstorm at an aerodrome
d. A sudden change in the weather conditions contained in the METAR

questions.question: What is the wind speed given in a METAR report based on?
options: a. The average speed of the previous 30 minutes
b. The strongest gust in the previous hour
c. The actual speed at the time of recording
d. The average speed of the previous 10 minutes

questions.question: Which of the following weather reports could be, in accordance with the regulations, abbreviated to "CAVOK"? (MSA above ground: LSZB 10000 FT, LSZH 8000 FT, LSGG 12000 FT, LFSB 6000 FT)
options: a. LFSB 24008KT 9999 SCT050 18/11 Q1017 RERA NOSIG =
b. LSZH VRB02KT 9000 BKN080 21/14 Q1022 NOSIG =
c. LSGG 22006KT 9999 BKN090 17/15 Q1008 RERA NOSIG =

questions.question: What does the term METAR signify?
options: a. A METAR is a flight forecast, issued by the meteorological station several times daily
b. A METAR is a landing forecast added to the actual weather report as a brief prognostic report
c. A METAR signifies the actual weather report at an aerodrome and is generally issued in half-hourly intervals
d. A METAR is a warning of dangerous meteorological conditions within a FIR

questions.question:
Does the following report make sense?
LSZH VRB02KT 5000 MIFG $02/02$ Q1015 NOSIG
options: a. The report would never be seen, because shallow fog is not reported when the meteorological visibility is more than 2 km
b. The report is nonsense, because it is impossible to observe a meteorological visibility of 5 km if shallow fog is reported
c. The report is not possible, because, with a temperature of $2^{\circ}C$ and a dew point of $2^{\circ}C$ there must be uniform fog
d. The report is possible, because shallow fog is defined as a thin layer of fog below eye level

questions.question: Runway Visual Range (RVR) is:
options: a. measured with ceilometers alongside the runway
b. usually better than meteorological visibility
c. reported when meteorological visibility is less than 2000 m
d. reported in TAFs and METARS

questions.question: When will the surface wind in a METAR record a gust factor?
options: a. With gusts of at least 25 kt
b. With gusts of at least 35 kt
c. When gusts are at least 10 kt above the mean wind speed
d. When gusts are at least 15 kt above the mean wind speed

questions.question: What does the term SIGMET signify?
options: a. A SIGMET is a brief landing forecast added to the actual weather report
b. A SIGMET is an actual weather report at an aerodrome and is generally issued at half-hourly intervals
c. A SIGMET is a warning of dangerous meteorological conditions
d. A SIGMET is a flight forecast, issued by the meteorological station several times daily

questions.question: In which weather report would you expect to find information about icing conditions on the runway?
A SPECI is:
options: a. an aviation routine weather report
b. a warning for special weather phenomena
c. a forecast for special weather phenomena
d. an aviation selected special weather report

questions.question:
Refer to the following TAF for Zurich.
LSZH 0610/0619 20018G30KT 9999 -RA SCT050 BKN080 TEMPO 0610/0615 23012KT 6000-DZ BKN015 BKN030 BECMG 0615/0618 23020G35KT 4000 RA OVC010=
The lowest cloud base forecast at ETA Zurich (1200 UTC) is:

Refer to the TAF for Bordeaux airport.
FCFR31 281400
LFBD 2815/2824 26015KT 9999 SHRA BKN020 TEMPO 2816/2820 26020G30KT 8000 +SHRA BKN015CB PROB30 2816/2820 TSRA =
Flight Lisbon to Bordeaux, ETA 1800 UTC. At ETA Bordeaux what is the lowest quoted visibility forecast?
Which of the following weather reports could be, in accordance with the regulations, abbreviated to "CAVOK"?
Which of the following weather reports is a warning of conditions that could be potentially hazardous to aircraft in flight ?

Refer to the TAF for Amsterdam airport.
FCNL31 281500
EHAM 2816/2901 14010KT 6000-RA SCT025 BECMG 2816/2818 12015G25KT SCT008 BKN013 TEMPO 2818/2823 3000 RA BKN005 OVC010 BECMG 2803/2901 25020KT 8000 NSW BKN020 =
Flight from Bordeaux to Amsterdam, ETA 2100 UTC. At ETA Amsterdam what surface wind is forecast ?

Within a short interval, several flight crews report that they have experienced strong clear air turbulence in certain airspace.
What is the consequence of these reports?
options: a. The airspace in question, will be temporarily closed
b. The competent aviation weather office will issue a SPECI
c. The competent aviation weather office will issue a storm warning
d. The competent aviation weather office will issue a SIGMET

questions.question:
In Zurich during a summer day the following weather observations were taken:
160450Z 23015KT 3000 +RA SCT008 SCT020 OVC030 13/12 Q1010 NOSIG =
160650Z 25008KT 6000 SCT040 BKN090 18/14 Q1010 RERA NOSIG =
160850Z 25006KT 8000 SCT040 SCT100 19/15 Q1009 NOSIG =
161050Z 24008KT 9999 SCT040 SCT100 21/15 Q1008 NOSIG =
161250Z 23012KT CAVOK 23/16 Q1005 NOSIG =
161450Z 23016KT 9999 SCT040 BKN090 24/17 Q1003 BECMG 25020G40KT TS =
161650Z 24018G35KT 3000 +TSRA SCT006 BKN015CB 18/16 Q1002 NOSIG =
161850Z 28012KT 9999 SCT030 SCT100 13/11 Q1005 NOSIG =
What do you conclude based on these observations?
options: a. A cold front passed the station early in the morning and a warm front during late afternoon
b. A trough line passed the station early in the morning and a warm front during late afternoon
c. Storm clouds due to warm air came close to and grazed the station
d. A warm front passed the station early in the morning and a cold front during late afternoon

questions.question:
Refer to the following TAF extract:
BECMG 0918/0921 2000 BKN004 PROB30 BECMG 0921/0924 0500 FG VV001
What does the abbreviation "PROB30" mean?
options: a. Change expected in less than 30 minutes
c. Conditions will last for at least 30 minutes
d. The cloud ceiling should lift to 3000 ft

questions.question:
Refer to the following TAF extract:
BECMG 2218/2221 2000 BKN004 PROB30 BECMG 2221/2224 0500 FG VV001
What visibility is forecast for 2400 UTC?
What is a TREND forecast?
options: a. An aerodrome forecast valid for 9 hours
b. A route forecast valid for 24 hours
d. A landing forecast appended to METAR/SPECI, valid for 2 hours

questions.question: SIGMET information is issued as a warning for significant weather to:
Which of the following phenomena can produce a risk of aquaplaning?
In which of the following 1850 UTC METAR reports, is the probability of fog formation, in the coming night, the highest?
How long from the time of observation is a TREND in a METAR valid?

Refer to the following TAF extract:
BECMG 1918/1921 2000 BKN004 PROB30 BECMG 1921/1924 0500 FG VV001
What does the abbreviation "BKN004" mean?
What is a SPECI?
options: a. A warning of meteorological dangers at an aerodrome, issued only when required
b. An aerodrome forecast issued every 9 hours
c. A selected special aerodrome weather report, issued when a significant change of the weather conditions have been observed
d. A routine aerodrome weather report issued every 3 hours

questions.question: Which of these four METAR reports suggests that rain is most likely in the next few hours?

Refer to the following TAF extract:
BECMG 1318/1321 2000 BKN004 PROB30 BECMG 1321/1324 0500 FG VV001
What does the abbreviation "VV001" mean?
If CAVOK is reported then:
options: a. low level windshear has not been reported
b. any CBs have a base above 5000 ft
c. no low drifting snow is present

questions.question:
The following weather message
EDDM 2413/2422 VRB03KT 1500 HZ OVC004 BECMG 2415/2417 00000KT 0500 FG VV002 TEMPΟ 2420/2422 0400 FG VV001
is a:

Which of the following statements is an interpretation of the METAR?
25020G38KT 1200 +TSGR BKN006 BKN015CB 23/18 Q1016 BECMG NSW =
options: a. Mean wind speed 20-38 kt, meteorological visibility 1200 metres, temperature $23^{\circ}C$
b. Broken, cloud base 600 ft and 1500 ft, temperature $18^{\circ}C$
c. Wind $250^{\circ}$ thunderstorm with moderate hail, QNH 1016 hPa
d. Gusts of 38 kt, thunderstorm with heavy hail, dew point $18^{\circ}C$

questions.question:
Which of the following weather reports could be, in accordance with the regulations, abbreviated to "CAVOK"?
(MSA above ground: LSZB 10000 FT, LSZH 8000 FT, LSGG 12000 FT, LFSB 6000 FT)
options: a. LSZH 26024G52KT 9999 BKN060 17/14 Q1012 RETS TEMPO 5000 TSRA =

questions.question: On the European continent METARs of main airports are compiled and distributed with intervals of:
The RVR, as reported in a METAR, is always the:
options: a. highest value of the A-, B- and C-position
b. lowest value of the A-, B- and C-position
c. value representative of the touchdown zone
d. average value of the A-, B- and C-position

questions.question:
In the TAF for Delhi (India), during the summer, for the time of your landing you note: TEMPO TS.
What is the maximum time this deterioration in weather can last in any one instance ?

Refer to the following TAF extract:
BECMG 3018/3021 2000 BKN004 PROB30 BECMG 3021/3024 0500 FG VV001
What does the "BECMG" data indicate for the 18 to 21 hour time frame?
options: a. A quick change to new conditions between 1800 UTC and 1900 UTC
b. Many short term changes in the original weather
c. Many long term changes in the original weather
d. The new conditions are achieved between 1800 and 2100 UTC

questions.question: The cloud base, reported in the METAR, is the height above:
options: c. the pressure altitude of the observation station at the time of observation
d. the highest terrain within a radius of 8 km from the observation station

questions.question:
Appended to a METAR you get the following runway report: 01650428
What must you consider when making performance calculations?
options: a. The braking action will be medium to good
b. The runway will be wet

questions.question: Which of these four METAR reports suggests that a thunderstorm is likely in the next few hours?
The wind direction in a METAR is measured relative to:
Which of the following weather reports could be, in accordance with the regulations, abbreviated to "CAVOK"?

Marseille Information gives you the following meteorological information for Ajaccio and Calvi for 1600 UTC:
Ajaccio: wind $360^{\circ}/2$ kt, visibility 2000 m, rain, BKN stratocumulus at 1000 FT, OVC altostratus at 8000 FT, QNH 1023 hPa.
Calvi: wind $040^{\circ}/2$ kt, visibility 3000 m, mist, FEW stratus at 500 FT, SCT stratocumulus at 2000 FT, OVC altostratus at 9000 FT, QNH 1023 hPa.
The ceilings (more than 4 oktas) are therefore:
options: a. 1000 FT at Ajaccio and 9000 FT at Calvi
b. 1000 FT at Ajaccio and 500 FT at Calvi
c. 8000 FT at Ajaccio and 9000 FT at Calvi
d. 1000 FT at Ajaccio and 2000 FT at Calvi

questions.question:
Which of the four answers is a correct interpretation of data from the following METAR?
16003KT 0400 R14/P1500 R16/1000N FZFG VV003 M02/M02 Q1026 BECMG 2000 =
options: a. Meteorological visibility 400 m, RVR for runway 16 1000 m, dew point $2^{\circ}C,$ freezing fog
b. RVR for runway 16 1000 m, meteorological visibility increasing in the next 2 hours to 2000 m, vertical visibility 300 m, temperature $-2^{\circ}C$
c. RVR for runway 14 1500 m, meteorological visibility 400 m, QNH 1026 hPa, wind $160^{\circ}$ at 3 kt
d. Meteorological visibility 1000 m, RVR 400 m, freezing level at 300 m, variable winds, temperature $2^{\circ}C$

questions.question:
You receive the following METAR:
LSGG 0750Z 00000KT 0300 R05/0700N FG VV001 M02/M02 Q1014 NOSIG =
What will be the RVR at 0900 UTC?
options: b. The RVR is unknown, because the "NOSIG" does not refer to RVR

questions.question:
Which of the following statements is an interpretation of the METAR?
00000KT 0200 R14/0800U R16/P1500U FZFG VV001 $m03/m03$ Q1022 BECMG 0800 =
options: a. Meteorological visibility 200 metres, RVR for runway 16 1500 metres, temperature $-3^{\circ}C$ vertical visibility 100 metres
b. Meteorological visibility 200 ft, RVR for runway 16 more than 1500 metres, vertical visibility 100 ft, fog with hoar frost
c. Meteorological visibility for runway 14 800 metres, fog with hoar frost, RVR for runway 16 more than 1500 metres
d. RVR for runway 14 800 metres, vertical visibility 100 ft, calm, meteorological visibility improving to 800 metres in the next 2 hours

questions.question:
Look at this TAF for Zurich Airport
TAF LSZH 2113/2122 22018G35KT 9999 SCT012 BKN030 BECMG 2113/2115 25025G45KT TEMPO 2117/2120 4000 +SHRA BKN025TCU BECMG 2120/2122 25015KT T1815Z T1618Z =
Which of these statements best describes the weather most likely to be experienced at 1500 UTC?
options: a. Meteorological visibility 10 kilometres or more, main cloud base 3000 ft, wind $250^{\circ}$ temperature $18^{\circ}C$
b. Meteorological visibility 4000 metres, gusts up to 25 kt, temperature $18^{\circ}C$
c. Meteorological visibility 10 kilometres or more, main cloud base 1200 ft, gusts up to 45 kt
d. Severe rain showers, meteorological visibility 4000 metres, temperature $15^{\circ}C,$ gusts up to 35 kt

questions.question: The validity of a TAF is:
options: c. 9 hours from the time of issue

questions.question: Runway visual range can be reported in:
options: d. both a TAF and a METAR

questions.question:
Refer to the TAF for Amsterdam airport.
FCNL31 281500
EHAM 2816/2901 14010KT 6000-RA SCT025 BECMG 2816/2818 12015G25KT SCT008 BKN013 TEMPO 2818/2823 3000 RA BKN005 OVC010 BECMG 2823/2901 25020KT 8000 NSW BKN020 =
Flight from Bordeaux to Amsterdam, ETA 2100 UTC.
What lowest cloud base is forecast for arrival at Amsterdam?
ATIS information contains:
options: d. operational information and if necessary meteorological information

questions.question: In METAR messages, the pressure group represents the:
options: a. QFE rounded to the nearest hPa
b. QNH rounded down to the nearest hPa
c. QFE rounded down to the nearest hPa
d. QNH rounded up to the nearest hPa

questions.question: What do the first four letters of the SIGMET message identify?
options: b. The ICAO identifier for the relevant airport
c. The name of the air traffic services controlling unit

questions.question:
What is the expected change in the weather intensity indicated by this SIGMET?
EGTT SIGMET 1 VALID 310730/311130 EGRR LONDON FIR ISOL CB FCST TOPS FL370 ROUTES W OF W00400 NC=
How would a severe mountain wave be coded in a SIGMET message?

In the following SIGMET message, what is the hazard forecast?
LFFF SIGMET 1 VALID 310600/311100 LFPW- UIR FRANCE MOD TURB FCST BLW FL420 W of 04W MOVE E 30KT NC=
options: a. Moderate turbulence at 42000 ft west of 4 degrees west and moving eastwards
b. Moderate turbulence below 42 000 ft west of 4 degrees west and moving from the east
c. Turbulence at 42 000 ft west of 4 degrees west and moving at 30 kt
d. Moderate turbulence below 42 000 ft west of 4 degrees west and moving eastwards
